attributes.additional_details:
MP’s can decide whether or not hospitals and schools have a ratings system, so it seems only fair that they should be subject to similar performance-based conditions.
All GP’s run local surgeries but some MP’s don’t bother, so a levelling-up system would help address this issue to the benefit of the voting public.
attributes.background: Decide on the best way for the public to rate their constituency MP

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to pay and conditions for MPs, including any potential performance-based requirements, are a matter for the Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA), not the UK Government or Parliament. You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599075
